channel.title: stokes / @ralexstokes
channel.description: Twitter feed for: @ralexstokes. Generated by nitter.freedit.eu

item.title:
sorry this is gonna be giga-niche
but i hope one day there is a PL where you can write any computation and then easily delimit some chunk to emit a ZKP during execution
think delimited continuation meets real-time proving
item.dc:creator: @ralexstokes
item.description:

item.title: RT by @ralexstokes: Let's try this, collecting some of the EF Research publications + collabs from this past week in the tweets below!
item.dc:creator: @barnabemonnot
item.description: Let's try this, collecting some of the EF Research publications + collabs from this past week in the tweets below!

item.title:
whats the state of the art on LLM-backed intents wallet for ethereum?
i should be able to tell an agent what i want to do, it should do biometric auth on my device for the entire flow, and then go off to execute
item.dc:creator: @ralexstokes
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @ralexstokes: Pectra is going live ü•≥
Holesky will fork at slot 3710976 (Mon, Feb 24 at 21:55:12 UTC) Sepolia will fork at slot 7118848 (Wed, Mar 5 at 07:29:36 UTC)
Assuming Sepolia goes smoothly, we'll pick the mainnet slot on the March 6 ACD call üìÖ
item.dc:creator: @TimBeiko
item.description:
Pectra is going live ü•≥

Holesky will fork at slot 3710976 (Mon, Feb 24 at 21:55:12 UTC)
Sepolia will fork at slot 7118848 (Wed, Mar 5 at 07:29:36 UTC)

Assuming Sepolia goes smoothly, we'll pick the mainnet slot on the March 6 ACD call üìÖ

item.title: RT by @ralexstokes: We should not ignore reality. The mempool is a crucial fallback, but very unlikely there's any path where it is the primary pipe through which txs end up onchain. It's important to design with this in mind: heavish block building, light inclusion list proposing
item.dc:creator: @fradamt
item.description:
We should not ignore reality. The mempool is a crucial fallback, but very unlikely there's any path where it is the primary pipe through which txs end up onchain. It's important to design with this in mind: heavish block building, light inclusion list proposing

nitter.freedit.eu/Data_Always/status/1882612445426180188#m

item.title:
genuinely curious to hear what we should do to improve ACD (dm's open!)
i've seen primarily two weak points from the recent discourse
i) latency of decision making and deployment pipeline ii) lack of longer term time horizon (e.g. to communicate commitments to users)
item.dc:creator: @ralexstokes
item.description:
genuinely curious to hear what we should do to improve ACD (dm's open!)

i've seen primarily two weak points from the recent discourse

i) latency of decision making and deployment pipeline
ii) lack of longer term time horizon (e.g. to communicate commitments to users)

item.title:
R to @ralexstokes: as part of this change, I‚Äôll no longer be the team lead at ARG; @kevaundray is the new team lead, bringing his deep expertise to help ethereum grow.
watch for the spectacular work coming from this group in 2025 ‚Äî it‚Äôs going to be a big year as we scale the world computer.
item.dc:creator: @ralexstokes

item.title: R to @ralexstokes: Protocol security: ensure software, specs behind the network is secure with a wide range of tools and bug bounty programs RIG: econ/game theory view to harden the mechanisms that make ethereum special
item.dc:creator: @ralexstokes
item.description:
Protocol security: ensure software, specs behind the network is secure with a wide range of tools and bug bounty programs
RIG: econ/game theory view to harden the mechanisms that make ethereum special

item.title: R to @ralexstokes: Applied Research Group (ARG): help translate theory into practice Consensus R&D: many interests focused around improving the consensus layer Cryptography: reduce trust at every part of the stack with fun mathematics
item.dc:creator: @ralexstokes
item.description:
Applied Research Group (ARG): help translate theory into practice
Consensus R&D: many interests focused around improving the consensus layer
Cryptography: reduce trust at every part of the stack with fun mathematics

item.title: R to @ralexstokes: Ethereum Foundation Research (EFR) formally consists of 5 teams that all strive to improve ethereum, each with different specialties:
item.dc:creator: @ralexstokes
item.description: Ethereum Foundation Research (EFR) formally consists of 5 teams that all strive to improve ethereum, each with different specialties:

item.title: I‚Äôll be stepping up as a co-lead with @barnabemonnot for research at the @ethereumfndn. Researchers at the EF are some of the most inspiring and passionate colleagues I‚Äôve found in life and I could not be more excited to support our work both inside and outside the EF.
item.dc:creator: @ralexstokes
